section.title: trunc function
section.para: Removes the fractional part of the argument.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: The trunc function returns the integer part of z. The function removes the decimal part of z, i.e. rounds against zero. z may be any numeric expression that evaluates to a real number or a complex number. If z is a complex number, the function returns trunc(re(z))+trunc(im(z))&imag;.

section.title: fract function
section.para: Returns the fractional part of the argument.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: The fract function returns the fractional part of z. The function removes the integer part of z, i.e. fract(z) = z - trunc(z). z may be any numeric expression that evaluates to a real number or a complex number. If z is a complex number, the function returns fract(re(z))+fract(im(z))&imag;.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: The ceil function finds the smallest integer not less than z. z may be any numeric expression that evaluates to a real number or a complex number. If z is a complex number, the function returns ceil(re(z))+ceil(im(z))&imag;.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: The floor function, which is also called the greatest integer function, gives the largest integer not greater than z. z may be any numeric expression that evaluates to a real number or a complex number. If z is a complex number, the function returns floor(re(z))+floor(im(z))&imag;.

section.title: round function
section.para: Rounds a number to the specified number of decimals.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: The round function rounds z to the number of decimals given by n. z may be any numeric expression that evaluates to a real number or a complex number. If z is a complex number, the function returns round(re(z),n)+round(im(z),n)&imag;. n may be any numeric expression that evaluates to an integer. If n<0, z is rounded to n places to the left of the decimal point.
